alert.note: Alert for Gibson; Pike (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 29 at 9:54AM EDT until June 29 at 3:30PM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 PM CDT/330 PM EDT/ THIS AFTERNOON FOR EASTERN GIBSON AND PIKE COUNTIES... At 854 AM CDT /954 AM EDT/, The public reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area with flooding of businesses and streets in Oakland City. Personal weather stations have picked up 4 to 4.5" of rain in the past 75 to 90 minutes from Oakland City to Petersburg. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Public reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Oakland City, Petersburg, Winslow, Francisco, Somerville, Hazleton, Spurgeon and Mackey. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
